subs.text: So although I would have taken a ride in the nice weather regardless, I actually had a VERY interesting, and unnerving, reason to make a 20 mile trek today. Last week I got an email from a bank saying ‚ÄúCongrats on opening your new checking account‚Äù. Except I don‚Äôt use that bank.
subs.rawText: So although I would have taken a ride in the nice weather regardless, I actually had a VERY interesting, and unnerving, reason to make a 20 mile trek today. Last week I got an email from a bank saying ‚ÄúCongrats on opening your new checking account‚Äù. Except I don‚Äôt use that bank.

subs.text: I figured it was a phishing scam, so I deleted the email. This week, I got an actual debit card for my new checking account at this bank. That freaked me out. So today, I rode out to the closest branch of the bank; I‚Äôm not naming it because it doesn‚Äôt matter to the story.
subs.rawText: I figured it was a phishing scam, so I deleted the email. This week, I got an actual debit card for my new checking account at this bank. That freaked me out. So today, I rode out to the closest branch of the bank; I‚Äôm not naming it because it doesn‚Äôt matter to the story.

subs.text: I got to the bank this afternoon and a teller asked if she could help me. I explained that I received a debit card but I don‚Äôt bank here. She shouted out ‚ÄúWe got another one‚Ä¶.‚Äù Apparently, I wasn‚Äôt the first person to have this happen to recently.
subs.rawText: I got to the bank this afternoon and a teller asked if she could help me. I explained that I received a debit card but I don‚Äôt bank here. She shouted out ‚ÄúWe got another one‚Ä¶.‚Äù Apparently, I wasn‚Äôt the first person to have this happen to recently.

subs.text: I was taken to an office with a bank rep and she explained to me that this has been happening a lot lately. She asked if she could take the debit card, which of course, I said yes. She cut it up after looking my license to verify I was who I said I was.
subs.rawText: I was taken to an office with a bank rep and she explained to me that this has been happening a lot lately. She asked if she could take the debit card, which of course, I said yes. She cut it up after looking my license to verify I was who I said I was.

subs.text: Then I asked ‚ÄúWhat information was tied to the checking account that I didn‚Äôt open?‚Äù We went through it all. When the account was opened they used my name, address, my son‚Äôs phone number (weird) and here‚Äôs the kicker: My exact social security number.
subs.rawText: Then I asked ‚ÄúWhat information was tied to the checking account that I didn‚Äôt open?‚Äù We went through it all. When the account was opened they used my name, address, my son‚Äôs phone number (weird) and here‚Äôs the kicker: My exact social security number.

subs.text: Needless to say, this is not good. I‚Äôve already frozen my credit reports but it‚Äôs very disconcerting that my SS is out there. Nothing I can do now but watch my credit, which shouldn‚Äôt have any changes due to freezing the account but‚Ä¶. WOW.
subs.rawText: Needless to say, this is not good. I‚Äôve already frozen my credit reports but it‚Äôs very disconcerting that my SS is out there. Nothing I can do now but watch my credit, which shouldn‚Äôt have any changes due to freezing the account but‚Ä¶. WOW.

@WarnerCrocker @HouseGOP I hear you. But as a registered independent, I try (sometimes too hard, I admit) to have an open mind and see the differing POV. This was just too far for me to keep quiet during a very turbulent time.

subs.text: I get that @HouseGOP thinks it's "owning the libs" with this. What it fails to realize (or even worse, does realize and ignores) is that a unified country & world suffers from this tripe. You do you GOP, but really: tone it down a notch by understanding you're not helping here. [link]
